summary: This document is an email chain from February 13, 2020, involving FBI public affairs and a journalist from the i newspaper in London. The journalist, Alys Key, inquires whether Jes Staley, CEO of Barclays Bank, has been asked to cooperate with the FBI's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, following news that UK regulators were examining Staley's representation of his relationship with Epstein.

persons.name: Alys Key
persons.context: Journalist from the i newspaper in London who emailed the FBI's National Press Office to inquire whether Jes Staley has been asked to cooperate with the FBI's Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Subject of the journalist's inquiry; UK financial regulator is investigating how he represented his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein to his employer and the board.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case; the email discusses the FBI's investigation into him and a regulator's inquiry into Jes Staley's relationship with him.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Addressed in an internal FBI email forwarding the journalist's inquiry; appears to be an FBI point of contact.

connections.description: The document references a dispute over how Staley represented his relationship with Epstein to his employer, indicating both a social and professional connection.
Key is a journalist inquiring about Staley's potential cooperation with the FBI Epstein investigation.

events.title: Journalist inquiry to FBI about Jes Staley
events.description: Alys Key, Deputy Business Editor at the i newspaper, emails the FBI's National Press Office to ask if Jes Staley has been asked to cooperate with the FBI's Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

events.title: UK regulator investigation into Jes Staley
events.description: News emerges that the UK financial regulator is looking into how Jes Staley represented his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein to his employer (Barclays) and how the board relayed that to the regulator.

keyFacts: In February 2020, UK financial regulators were investigating Jes Staley, CEO of Barclays Bank, regarding how he represented his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein to his employer.
A journalist from the i newspaper contacted the FBI to inquire whether Staley had been asked to cooperate with the FBI's Epstein investigation.
The FBI's public affairs office declined to comment on the inquiry, stating it was not something they could discuss.
The document indicates ongoing media and regulatory scrutiny of high-profile associates of Jeffrey Epstein following his death.
